After studying Molecular Biophysics and Biochemistry at Yale, Dr. Timberlake, in his late 30’s, continued his medical and graduate studies at Yale, graduating cum laude from the medical school and with a PhD in Genetics.

He completed his residency in Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery at NYU Langone’s Wyss Department of Plastic Surgery. He was trained by Dr. David Rosenberg, before joining him in practice.

“Nearly all of my patients are from word of mouth referrals,” Dr. Timberlake told The Post — explaining that mostly, a little zhush is what they’re after, with deep plane face and necklift with an endoscopic browlift two favorites.

Some patients, like Charlotte Groeneveld, can deliver an awful lot of referrals. With nearly 600,000 Instagram followers, the fashion insider chose Dr. Timberlake before a big birthday.

“I decided for my 40th. This was the perfect gift to myself,” the mother of three told The Post.

“He’s an incredible person and so hardworking. He has so many clients you would never know about because people don’t really share about it. He’s a special one, you have to find him,” she said. 

Charlotte went for an endoscopic browlift, upper and lower blepharoplasty, and laser resurfacing. “I didn’t want someone to change my face,” she shares, “I wanted to look like myself, but refreshed.” 

Her recovery was a breeze — “I went to the Hamptons for an event with Gucci ten days later” — and she’s thrilled with her results.

“The second I look in a mirror and I see myself, it’s how I felt like I was always supposed to look. Fresh and not tired,” she said.

Dr. Timberlake’s surgical waitlist is currently months out, which at least, is quicker than a Birkin.

225 E. 64th St., (212) 832-8595; http://www.instagram.com/drandrewtimberlake

The quiet luxury king

Dr. Ira Savetsky

$15,000-$20,000 for a browlift

Dressed head-to-toe in Loro Piana with a youthful, effortless aura, Dr. Savetsky is the “nice guy” surgeon New Yorkers trust across generations. Husband to Lizzy and father of three, he boasts upwards of 450k followers on Instagram, where he shares intimate glimpses of family life and candid post-procedure patient talks on Instagram. 

Known for his facelifts, subtle eye work and rhinoplasties so natural you’d never guess, the 41-year-old has cultivated a following that spans from the Upper East Side to the influencer crowd — just ask Jill Zarin and Dina Lohan, both of whom openly credit him for flawless work. 

For Bronwyn Sciarrino, a NP and co-owner of Elite Private Recovery, offering private nursing for post-surgery care, choosing Dr. Savetsky was a no-brainer.

“I’ve been a nurse for plastic surgeons for over fifteen years, I could have chosen anybody to go to but I’ve been able to see his results first hand and I knew he would do right by me,” Sciarrino, 42, told The Post of her recent upper blepharoplasty and browlift.

For her, what stood out was Dr. Savetsky’s exacting attention to detail — calling him “meticulous and a perfectionist.

“It’s also how humble he is,” she explained. “He’s got this humble elegance about him that you want to be around. He listens and is an all around great person in addition to being a talented surgeon.”

The results, she said, speak for themselves: “People do not believe I am 42. I was recently on a flight to London and the flight attendant offered me a mimosa and she said “Wait, are you old enough?”

Taylor McMillan, a recent rhinoplasty recipient, also praised the doc’s demeanor: “Dr. Savetsky is a genuine person and his charisma helped the process be more comfortable. I’ve had friends who’ve had experiences where they were told they needed a rhinoplasty to be pretty and Dr. Savetsky is not like that at all.”

The nose shrinker’s rep is backed by top-tier training — including residency and fellowship programs under his belt including  the NYU Hansjörg Wyss Department of Plastic Surgery and his aesthetic fellowship at the Dallas Plastic Surgery Institute.

Dr. Savetsky told The Post that his patents are commonly referencing a handful of celebrities when they come in for a consult.

“For the face I’ve been getting Kris Jenner. Nose is Kate Middleton, and for brows and eyes it’s Anne Hathaway,” he said.

His surgery waitlist is currently six months long.  

737 Park Ave., (212) 300-9863; http://www.instagram.com/drirasavetsky/

The yoga boob queen

Dr. Anna Steve

$35,000 for minimally-invasive breast augmentation

The reigning queen of ballerina breasts and yoga boobs, women are flocking to Dr. Steve for stylish small-volume breast augmentations, as a new generation embraces the understated aesthetic over the Baywatch-style look.

With her stunning looks and soft-spoken charm, the 35-year-old is the talk of every heated mat pilates class in the city— in a world increasingly shaped by GLP-1s and lean physiques, Dr. Steve knows that bigger isn’t always better.

“My calling card is small volume implants using minimally invasive techniques and even sometimes wide awake with only local anesthesia,” Dr. Steve, part of Neinstein Plastic Surgery on Park Avenue, told The Post — revealing that the most-requested chest, currently, is Kendall Jenner’s.

“We have patients fly from all over the world to NYC to have small volume implants and more minimally invasive procedures,” she said — noting that her lively social media presence has been a boon, calling it “a great way for patients to find a surgeon who is the right fit for them before they even begin the consultation process.” 

Glasgow, Scotland-based creator and model Madison Nicole is one of the long-haulers who found Dr. Steve on Instagram.

“I was immediately hooked on watching through all her videos because not only were they educational, but I truly felt like she approached breast augmentation from a different angle than most. The lens of confidence and womanhood, rather than sexuality and the male gaze,” she told The Post.

After an online consultation, Nicole booked her surgery, “I felt calm in a way that one can only feel when they are truly being seen and heard. She met me with open ears, ready to listen and with affirming and objective answers to all of my questions.”

Nicole opted for 230cc Motiva Ergonomix Demi implants over the muscle — with local anesthesia only.

“Because I had a negative previous experience with anesthesia, I opted to do the procedure under local anesthesia only — one of the biggest factors playing into my decision to work with Dr. Steve,” she explained.

She administered local anesthetic blocks via several injections in each breast.  The procedure took an hour,  and after a life of self-confessed struggles with flat-chestedness, Madison loves her tasteful results,

“I feel like me — I’ve found myself excited to be in my own skin, excited to get dressed to leave the house, excited to take photos and make silly videos with my friends, excited to simply exist,” she said.

Dr. Steve is currently booking December 2026 dates — but has some availability sooner than that, for flexible patients.

110 E. 60th St., (212) 249-0949; http://www.instagram.com/annakstevemd

The body sculptor

Dr. Darren Smith

$20,000 for a hybrid tummy tuck

When Emily Dodge first walked into body contouring maestro Dr. Smith’s chic Ritz Tower practice, she knew she was in the right place.

Another surgeon had been pressuring her into a full tummy tuck to revise a C-section scar — and she wasn’t convinced.

“I wanted something minimal with less recovery and small tweaks, and he was totally on board,” Dodge, 38, told The Post. “Dr. Smith doesn’t look at you like a number. He looks at you like a person.”

From Mounjaro users looking to cinch up loose skin, to new moms in need of a sleek makeover, Dr. Smith is the go-to for a growing number of patients, who are after the “long and lean” aesthetic, the Brown University and University of Pittsburgh-trained practitioner, 46, told The Post.

His top treatments include breast augmentations, hybrid tummy tucks, brachioplasties, and a full range of body work — with a lot of patients mentioning Margot Robbie’s breasts and Jennifer Lopez’s toned stomachs on their wish lists, Dr. Smith said.

He’s known for his rapid recovery method for breast augmentations, which includes meticulous dissection to minimize tissue trauma and instilling a long-acting local anesthetic into the implant pocket at the time of surgery to minimize narcotic use post-op — meaning you can be having dinner at Casa Tua just two days after your procedure.

“I would send 100 people to him if I could — he’s a gem,” Dodge said, reporting that confidence and her clothing options have expanded greatly. “I can wear all of the clothes I had before I was pregnant. I feel more confident, but mainly, I think it’s feeling more comfortable in my skin.”

Dr. Smith is currently booking for January 2026, early enough to debut your body tweaks on an impromptu trip to Miami this winter.

111 E. 57th St., (212) 633-0627; http://www.instagram.com/nycplasticsdoc/
item.author: Micaela English
